intro: Kentrochrosia triangularis, commonly known as the triangular kentrochrosia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, making it well adapted to drought conditions. Kentrochrosia triangularis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and resilience.
